TopicTitle: How do you run tons of missions at once?

Articles.Content:
I have found myself in a rut. I would realy like to have a super hectic carrer mode game, but I always find myself launching and finishing one mission at a time. I have KAC but I still have no Idea what I have to do to get a bunch of missions going at once.

Any tips?

You need to upgrade Mission control so you can accept multiple contracts at once.

Then it's just planning how you can achieve multiple missions on a single contract.

> Any tips?

Hi,

Use less timewarp and launch other craft during long trips and also do other things once you've reach a place to "park" your ships. A few for instances:

I went to Dres with a probe. Launched it to orbit, and calculated the maneuver. from there it was hundreds of days until it arrived at Dres' SOI, so I made an KAC alarm for few days before it hit the SOI and went back to the KSC to think of another mission.

KAC tells me when transfer windows will be coming for various planets. Jool's might be coming up first, but I got Duna on my mind. Make a Duna ship, send it to LKO and go back to KSC and do something else. You can retake command of that ship, when the window for Duna comes up.

Less timewarping gives you oodles of time before having to actually do something, so just get that imagination working and think of other goals.

Proper KAC usage is key here, because you'll have several to-do's hanging around and you have to make sure not to miss them.
So should I basically be sending something out every transfer window, and then doing stuff with the mun and minmus in between?

You can skip windows if you have no interest in going there, to be sure; they'll just take awhile to come around again. You don't need to wait for the windows either, you just need a much bigger spaceship to get to the destination if you leave outside a window.

The fun part of this is you'll get an alarm to do something for XYZ craft headed for ABC and you'll have forgotten even building it. 

"Oh wow, hey, there's that Eloo probe I forgot about, it almost arrived!"

Maybe try the [Construction Time mod](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/92377-1-0-x-Kerbal-Construction-Time-1-1-8-%2806-18-15%29-Unrapid-Planned-Assembly). It makes time a resource that also needs to be managed by making everything take time to complete. Vessels take time to build, building upgrades time to complete, research time to unlock, and so on. It will get you to focus on scheduling and fly concurrent missions because otherwise there will be long periods when nothing is getting done. A life support mod will also force you to focus on mission duration since you will have to think ahead and plan accordingly.

I find it comes naturally. As segments of multi part missions complete, new contacts become available. I can accept , launch, and complete LKO contracts mid Munar mission and Munar contracts mid Minmus mission.

That doesn't include the infrastructure I build for myself.

I set up at least one high accuracy Keosynchronus satilite over KSC for a good ship to timewarp from.

I also set up a ring of small (sub 30 part) fuel depots in a 100 km orbit for LKO fuel logistics. No craft returns with any full tanks.

I utilize station contracts to place labs around bodies. They come with landers to keep the data maxed.

I'm currently getting my tug network to the point where I can keep reentry heads (Claw with parachutes, RCS, and docking port) on station at bodies to cut rescue/recover mission time in half!

I have so much going on, several of my SSTO lifter missions can wait up to an in game day for the 25 min window needed to land.

Once I launch my Duna exploration, I expect to use time warp for longer periods.

I normally like to keep my alarms 30 minutes apart but even in Kerbins SOI it takes 9 days for a ship to get to Minimus. In that time I can reascue 15 kerbals and land on the mun 8 times and Build 10 stations. I normally have 10+ alarms set up. Do a burn, set an alarm switch to a different ship never go faster then 4 arrows. Quick saving and good designs are extra important since once you switch you can not revert. On my career I think I had all the Mun and Minimus biomes done by day 22ish. Although I am still face palming as I brought enough fuel to do 50+ landing on minimus but I cleared all the science in 5....
You don't need to strictly follow transfer windows - giving yourself extra 200~300m/s for transfer opens up a whole lot of other time period that you can transfer.

Where's that guy that invaded eve with like 500 launches at the same time? He probably could give some tips!

----

Oh here: [http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/129260-KSP-Wasn-t-Designed-For-This](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/129260-KSP-Wasn-t-Designed-For-This)

One thing to do is complete the easy contracts and accumulate some contracts you can do in one trip. I am using a single vessel to conplete some Mun/Minmud missions involving tourists, astronauts, and rescues.

Last night I launched a lander can with 8 command seats on it, and enough fuel to get to minmus. It was a two part with a command module of two cans and the lander part with a can and seats. Goal was to complete some contracts but also take a team of astronauts on mun orbit and minmus landing to train them up to level 3.

The two cans in command module held two tourists that wanted a mun orbit.

I first rescued 3 astronauts. In one case after rescuing one, a minor maneuver gave me a intersect with anothet rewcue orbit. Rather than spend a bunch of fuel matching orbit, I burned retro a bit to halfway match, then switched to the rescue astronaut and used EVA to chase down and board the vessel, since EVA is really efficient. It was a challenge because I wizzed by at 200 m/s but had plenty EVA left to catch up.

I went back to LKO docked with space station to refuel. Now I will be off to Mun for an orbit then to Minmus to land, plant flags for xp, and do a few crew reports.

I have several contracts I will complete in visiting Minmus because I've essentially been conpleting others and letting them accumulate.

Not only that but my newly rescued astronauts will get some XP before they get back to Kerbal.
